dt: {bc}weakened or thinned by or as if by having been mixed with something else (such as water)

dt.t: Just be sure not to confuse peppermint oil, which is concentrated and thus far more potent, with peppermint extract, a {wi}diluted{/wi} mixture that contains approximately 20% peppermint oil.
The most common method of skin testing is the scratch test, where a {wi}diluted{/wi} amount of the allergen is applied to a scratch on the back or arm.
… the {wi}diluted{/wi} light of a north European summer …
… his photos capture urban landscapes with muted slightly {wi}diluted{/wi} colours that have a gritty appeal.
… wielding {wi}diluted{/wi} power in a deadlocked government in a tiny state …

dt: {bc}having a decreased per share value due to an increase in the total number of shares

dt.t: {wi}Diluted{/wi} shares can be tricky to calculate, especially when it comes to stock options, which are the most common obligation to issue shares that companies face.

shortdef: weakened or thinned by or as if by having been mixed with something else (such as water)
having a decreased per share value due to an increase in the total number of shares

dt.t: {it}diluting{/it} the quality of the finished product

dt: {bc}to make thinner or more liquid by admixture
{bc}to diminish the strength, flavor, or brilliance of (something) by or as if by admixture

dt.t: But spreading the light out also {wi}dilutes{/wi} it …

dt: {bc}to decrease the per share value of ({d_link|common stock|common stock}) by increasing the total number of shares

et: Latin {it}dilutus{/it}, past participle of {it}diluere{/it} to wash away, dilute, from {it}di-{/it} + {it}lavere{/it} to wash {ma}{mat|lye|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make thinner or more liquid by admixture
to diminish the strength, flavor, or brilliance of (something) by or as if by admixture
